question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to ensure the generated code is executable. Help me create a web-based universal data calling template tool that connects to MySQL databases. The tool should allow users to visually drag database table fields into the tool and perform SQL query searches on the data. It should enable visual report creation, save report templates, automatically generate reports in the same format for different time periods, and allow creation of different templates.

checklist.title: Is the database connection and management system properly implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code includes secure MySQL connection handling with proper authentication, connection pooling, and error handling. Check if the implementation includes database configuration options, SSL support, and connection timeout settings. Score 0 if connection functionality is missing, 5 if basic connection is implemented without security measures, and 10 if a complete, secure, and robust connection system is implemented with proper error handling.

checklist.title: Is the visual drag-and-drop interface for database fields fully functional?
checklist.description: Evaluate the implementation of the drag-and-drop interface for database tables and fields. Check if it includes field metadata display, proper visual feedback during drag operations, and accurate drop target handling. The interface should correctly render different field types with appropriate icons. Deduct 3 points if drag-and-drop is buggy, 5 points if it lacks visual feedback, and 2 points if it doesn't handle all MySQL field types properly. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the SQL query builder properly implemented with validation?
checklist.description: Check if the SQL query builder allows users to visually construct queries with proper conditions, joins, grouping, and sorting. Verify that it includes SQL injection prevention, query validation, and query optimization suggestions. Score 0 if the query builder is not implemented, 5 if it only supports basic queries without validation, and 10 if it fully supports complex queries with proper validation, optimization, and security measures.

checklist.title: Is the report template creation and management system complete?
checklist.description: Assess whether users can create, save, edit, and delete report templates. Check if templates support various visualizations (tables, charts, etc.), conditional formatting, and custom layouts. Verify that the system includes template versioning, sharing capabilities, and template categories. Deduct 5 points if template saving is not implemented, 3 points if template editing is limited, and 5 points if there's no template management interface. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as invalid database credentials, SQL errors, network interruptions, browser compatibility issues, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. AI-assisted query suggestions 2. Natural language to SQL conversion 3. Real-time collaborative editing 4. Advanced data visualization options). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple query builders coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to data reporting (e.g., a built-in file manager) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations when switching between reports). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating database/UI/templating layers), unit test coverage, and build process automation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the build process is not automated. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Click feedback delay ≤ 100ms 2) Transition animation duration controlled between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual focus guidance when working with data fields and report elements. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for visual after-images during fast scrolling through data tables, and 5 points for hard-to-find key function buttons. The full score is 10 points.
